title: Problems of the Italian school system 2019
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 9 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and lowest at Response Others.
Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has 13.0 times more Share of respondents than Response Others which is has the lowest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 9 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and lowest at Response Others.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 9 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and lowest at Response Others.
Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has 13.0 times more Share of respondents than Response Others which is has the lowest.
max_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has the highest Share of respondents and Others has the lowest Share of respondents.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Response Lack of funding and resources.
Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has 13.0 times more Share of respondents than Response Others which is has the lowest.

Share of respondents at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market is 26.0 , second place is Lack of funding and resources at 21.0, and thirdly is Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students at 13.0.
Response Bad teachers, and Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students have a similar Share of respondents that is 13.0.
The lowest value 2.0 at Others is almost 2.34 times smaller than the average value 11.11.
The Share of respondents is 100.0 if we add up values of all Responses.

data.Response: Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market
Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students
